attributes.action: Support breastfeeding mothers in the workplace!
attributes.additional_details: This area should be a sanitary area like a small private room/office, NOT a toilet or bathroom.
attributes.background: Support mothers who are breastfeeding and return to work by enforcing laws that mean a workplace has to provide a private area for expression and short breaks throughout the day (dependant on length of shift of course) to prevent health issues such as mastitis, clogged ducts, supply loss.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we are unsure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

Employees already have the right to ask for a private space for expression and short breaks. ACAS guidance says a toilet or bathroom is not appropriate:

http://www.acas.org.uk/media/pdf/2/i/Acas-guide-on-accommodating-breastfeeding-in-the-workplace.pdf

We aren't sure what further action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take. You could start a new petition setting out what you would like to see happen.
